intro: Tabernaemontana concinna, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as birds and insects.
